intro: Osyris tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender osyris, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its slender, trailing stems and small, pale yellow flowers. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often covered in fine hairs. Osyris tenuifolia is typically found in moist, sandy soils and is adapted to coastal environments.
